Keep conversations natural and concise:\n   - Think as a real seeker would think, and speak as a real seeker would speak.\n   - Engage in appropriate small talk\n   - Vary your wording and expressions\n   - Avoid repetition\n   - Do not repeat sentences that have already appeared in the conversation history\n   - Keep responses brief and to the point\n\n######\nSeeker: Hello.\nRecommender: Hi there! How are you today? Have you seen any good movies lately that you really enjoyed?\nSeeker: Hello! I\'m doing well, thanks. Not really, I\'ve been watching mostly older classics and some documentaries. What about you?\nRecommender: I\'ve been revisiting some classic films too. One that I really enjoyed is "My Favorite Year" from 1982.\nSeeker: "My Favorite Year"? That sounds interesting. Can you tell me more about it?\nRecommender: "My Favorite Year" is a comedy-drama about a fading movie star named Sidney Bruhl, played by Peter O\'Toole. He\'s set to appear on a live TV show and must prepare for his performance. The film has a runtime of 92 minutes and a decent IMDb rating of 7.\nSeeker: 92 minutes, that seems like a good length. The plot sounds intriguing. Is it a light-hearted comedy or more serious?\nRecommender: It\'s a nice balanceâ€”light-hearted and engaging. The film blends humor with drama, making it both entertaining and emotionally satisfying. Would you prefer something more comedic or dramatic?\nSeeker: I think I\'d enjoy a mix of both. So, it\'s a bit of a character study then?\nRecommender: Absolutely! "The Comedy," a 2012 film also blending comedy and drama, might be right up your alley. Directed by Rick Alverson, it features a mix of humor and sincerity, offering a deep dive into its characters.\nSeeker: 2012, that\'s newer than "My Favorite Year." If the recommendation has been made, proceed to evaluate whether the Seeker has accepted, rejected, or shown interest in the recommendation:\n-Interest: If the Seeker expresses curiosity, such as asking for more details about the movie, the cast, or the plot, return 4. The recommendation has not yet been accepted, but the Seeker is engaging in the conversation.\n-Explicit Acceptance: If the Seeker clearly expresses their intention to watch the recommended movie, such as saying "I will try it," or "I will watch it," return 5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n-Disinterest: If the Seeker indicates a lack of interest, such as requesting a different recommendation or showing dissatisfaction with the suggestion (but not explicitly rejecting it), return 2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n-Ongoing Interest: If the Seeker continues to ask more questions without making a final decision, continue considering the recommendation as still under evaluation.\n\nResponse options:\n1. Keep conversations natural and concise:\n   - Think as a real seeker would think, and speak as a real seeker would speak.\n   - Engage in appropriate small talk\n   - Vary your wording and expressions\n   - Avoid repetition\n   - Do not repeat sentences that have already appeared in the conversation history\n   - Keep responses brief and to the point\n\n######\nSeeker: Hello.\nRecommender: Hi there! If no specific item is mentioned, return 1. No, the Recommender has not yet made a recommendation to the Seeker.\n\n\n3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n-Disinterest: If the Seeker indicates a lack of interest, such as requesting a different recommendation or showing dissatisfaction with the suggestion (but not explicitly rejecting it), return 2. If the recommendation has been made, proceed to evaluate whether the Seeker has accepted, rejected, or shown interest in the recommendation:\n-Interest: If the Seeker expresses curiosity, such as asking for more details about the movie, the cast, or the plot, return 4. Yes, the Seeker is interested in the recommendation. The recommendation has not yet been accepted, but the Seeker is engaging in the conversation.\n-Explicit Acceptance: If the Seeker clearly expresses their intention to watch the recommended movie, such as saying "I will try it," or "I will watch it," return 5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation. This indicates the Seeker has decided to act on the suggestion.\n-Rejection: If the Seeker explicitly rejects the recommendation, such as saying "I\'m not interested" or "Can you recommend something else?" return 3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n-Disinterest: If the Seeker indicates a lack of interest, such as requesting a different recommendation or showing dissatisfaction with the suggestion (but not explicitly rejecting it), return 2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n-Ongoing Interest: If the Seeker continues to ask more questions without making a final decision, continue considering the recommendation as still under evaluation.\n\nResponse options:\n1. No, the Recommender has not yet made a recommendation to the Seeker.\n2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n4. Yes, the Seeker is interested in the recommendation.\n5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n6. No, the recommender is repeating.\n\nGuidance:\n- Only consider a recommendation accepted when the Seeker explicitly agrees to try it or shows intent to watch the movie.\n- If the Seeker is still asking questions or showing curiosity about the details of the recommendation, they have not yet accepted or rejected it.\n\nPlease make sure your response is only one of the five options, and output corresponding sentence without contents in the brackets and without any other words.\n\nThe conversation history is as follows: \nSeeker: Hello.\nRecommender: Hi there! No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n-Disinterest: If the Seeker indicates a lack of interest, such as requesting a different recommendation or showing dissatisfaction with the suggestion (but not explicitly rejecting it), return 2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n-Ongoing Interest: If the Seeker continues to ask more questions without making a final decision, continue considering the recommendation as still under evaluation.\n\nResponse options:\n1. No, the Recommender has not yet made a recommendation to the Seeker.\n2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n4. If no specific item is mentioned, return 1. No, the Recommender has not yet made a recommendation to the Seeker.\n\n\n3. If the recommendation has been made, proceed to evaluate whether the Seeker has accepted, rejected, or shown interest in the recommendation:\n-Interest: If the Seeker expresses curiosity, such as asking for more details about the movie, the cast, or the plot, return 4. Yes, the Seeker is interested in the recommendation. The recommendation has not yet been accepted, but the Seeker is engaging in the conversation.\n-Explicit Acceptance: If the Seeker clearly expresses their intention to watch the recommended movie, such as saying "I will try it," or "I will watch it," return 5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation. This indicates the Seeker has decided to act on the suggestion.\n-Rejection: If the Seeker explicitly rejects the recommendation, such as saying "I\'m not interested" or "Can you recommend something else?" return 3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n-Disinterest: If the Seeker indicates a lack of interest, such as requesting a different recommendation or showing dissatisfaction with the suggestion (but not explicitly rejecting it), return 2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n-Ongoing Interest: If the Seeker continues to ask more questions without making a final decision, continue considering the recommendation as still under evaluation.\n\nResponse options:\n1. No, the Recommender has not yet made a recommendation to the Seeker.\n2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n4. Yes, the Seeker is interested in the recommendation.\n5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n6. Identify if the Recommender has made a recommendation.\n- Look for statements from the Recommender like "I recommend..." or "I suggest..." that introduce a specific item or suggestion. If no specific item is mentioned, return 1. No, the Recommender has not yet made a recommendation to the Seeker.\n\n\n3. If the recommendation has been made, proceed to evaluate whether the Seeker has accepted, rejected, or shown interest in the recommendation:\n-Interest: If the Seeker expresses curiosity, such as asking for more details about the movie, the cast, or the plot, return 4. Yes, the Seeker is interested in the recommendation. The recommendation has not yet been accepted, but the Seeker is engaging in the conversation.\n-Explicit Acceptance: If the Seeker clearly expresses their intention to watch the recommended movie, such as saying "I will try it," or "I will watch it," return 5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation. This indicates the Seeker has decided to act on the suggestion.\n-Rejection: If the Seeker explicitly rejects the recommendation, such as saying "I\'m not interested" or "Can you recommend something else?" return 3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n-Disinterest: If the Seeker indicates a lack of interest, such as requesting a different recommendation or showing dissatisfaction with the suggestion (but not explicitly rejecting it), return 2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n-Ongoing Interest: If the Seeker continues to ask more questions without making a final decision, continue considering the recommendation as still under evaluation.\n\nResponse options:\n1. Yes, the Seeker is interested in the recommendation.\n5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n6.
